"9/10 better than global offensive

needs more good servers though"
-Original review, from when I was still mentally 10 and got mad at CSGO because I was getting meme'd on by hackers and smurfs.

I want to come back to this with a more detailed review, and while I'll keep this a positive, I believe CSGO is better at this point in time.

Counter-Strike Source, a game I only got for Garry's Mod textures, and found a game where there are still fun and mature community servers, such as one I used to play whenever I got on the game: called Arlington Adaptive Bots or something like that. The easy moddability of this game is also pretty great, while not being as easy as subscribing to a workshop item, still pretty easy once you get the hang of it. Most mods are client-side cosmetic items, because it is a multiplayer game for the most part. There's not really much to say about this game, it's a good Half-Life 2 modification with some great community servers still running.

CSGO for better graphics and mechanics, CSS for better community.

What the hell are you doing reading the negatives to this game?

I don't understand the unlockables nor the progression system. The in-game currency is way too close to real life money. What do they think this is? Personal finance simulator? There are very limited gun attachements and absolutely no perks. What's more, when I get multiple consecutive kills the kill streak fanfare doesn't see to work. So there's absolutely nothing to tell me how cool I am and to inflate my already huge ego.  10/10 Must play.

First things first. This game looks just right and textures are perfect to give a smooth gameplay fps.The gameplay is very friendly on mouse controls. There are also really good available servers for different game modes.

I would prefer this game from all other counter strike titles. However, there is really not an intensive rewarding system like that in csgo. This can be frustrating. But considering how old it is, there can be little support from VALVE.

The "Test of Time" Award
